meanings.definition: To deprive of courage or confidence
meanings.sent1: Constant criticism discourages students from trying new things.
meanings.sent2: The coach's encouraging words can discourage fear in the team.
meanings.sent3: The scary movie discouraged me from going to bed alone.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds discouraged any hope of a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind discourages the birds from flying too high.

meanings.definition: To dissuade from a course of action
meanings.sent1: His warnings discouraged her from taking the dangerous path.
meanings.sent2: The safety precautions are meant to discourage accidents.
meanings.sent3: The loud alarm discouraged him from sneaking out at night.
meanings.sent4: The red traffic light discourages drivers from speeding through.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's advice discourages students from procrastinating.

meanings.sent1: The locked gate discourages unauthorized entry into the property.
meanings.sent2: A strong password can discourage hackers from accessing your accounts.
meanings.sent3: The rain discouraged the picnic plans for the weekend.
meanings.sent4: The high wall discourages the view of the beautiful garden.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog discourages safe navigation for ships.
